CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To our best knowledge , the FF is the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers The surface morphology of the active layers was studied using atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) under tapping mode in order to further understand why the device exhibited better photovoltaic properties at the annealing temperature of 120 ° C. Figure S8 shows typical AFM topography of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film in unannealed and annealed conditions ( see Supporting Information ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| FF |
| side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |

Explanation:

* "FF" is mentioned as a material in the context of it being the highest reported to date for side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers.
* "side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers" is explicitly referred to as a material.
* "PBDT-TDPP-S" and "PC71BM" are materials mentioned in the description of the atomic force microscopy (AFM) topography.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |

Explanation:

* "FF" is not a clear material name, so it has been removed.
* "side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers" is explicitly referred to as a material.
* "PBDT-TDPP-S" and "PC71BM" are materials mentioned in the description of the atomic force microscopy (AFM) topography.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To our best knowledge , the FF is the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers The surface morphology of the active layers was studied using atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) under tapping mode in order to further understand why the device exhibited better photovoltaic properties at the annealing temperature of 120 ° C. Figure S8 shows typical AFM topography of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film in unannealed and annealed conditions ( see Supporting Information ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| The FF |
| side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers |
| 120 ° C |
| unannealed and annealed conditions |
| PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film |

The "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

* "The FF" refers to the fill factor, a key parameter in photovoltaic device performance.
* "side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers" refers to a type of polymer used in organic photovoltaic devices.
* "120 ° C" is the annealing temperature mentioned in the paragraph.
* "unannealed and annealed conditions" refer to the conditions under which the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film was studied.
* "PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film" is a specific type of material used in the photovoltaic device.

| The FF |

The only "Value of material property" entity in the paragraph is:
